thread.title: Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach No. 8 in U.S. for reducing commutes by car
thread.title_full: Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach No. 8 in U.S. for reducing commutes by car

author: Cindy Barth
title: Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach No. 8 in U.S. for reducing commutes by car
text:
Mark Freerks The Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach metro is No. 8 among U.S. metros that have seenâ€¦ more The Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach metro is No. 8 among U.S. metros that have seen the greatest decline in commuting by car, according to a report released this month by the U.S. Census Bureau . The report, "Who Drives to Work? Commuting by Automobile in the United States 2013," ranks 15 metros that have a population of 500,000 or more with the greatest drop in the percentage of workers 16 and older who commuted by automobile between 2006 and 2013. In 2006, 92 percent of Deltona-Daytona Beach-Ormond Beach workers commuted by car; In 2013, the percentage dropped to 89.4. San FRancisco-Oakland-Hayward, Calif., topped the list, going from 73.6 percent of workers 16 and older who commuted by automobile in 2006 to 69.8 percent by 2013. The only other Florida metro to make the list was Cape Coral-Fort Myers, which came in at No. 4. Nationwide, "the automobile continues to dominate work-related travel, but the rate of automobile commuting has stabilized in recent years after decades of increase," notes the report.
